plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
‚ùó Currently in BETA - let me know in comments below if you find bugs!


Instantly switch to a different theme by swaping variables and styles in your screens/components.


How it works:


1. Create your styles and variables having a theme name as a top folder name, e.g.:

ThemeA/color/bg/primary
ThemeB/color/bg/primary
ThemeC/color/bg/primary

ThemeA/radius/card
ThemeB/radius/card
ThemeC/radius/card


2. Use your theme variables and styles in components and screens.

3. Select any element (component, frame, or text)

4. Pick themes to swap from and to (e.g. "ThemeB" ‚Üí "ThemeC")

5. Swap all variables and styles within a selection with just one click!


Save time and effort in your design process by quickly adapting your screens to various themes.


Unlike Figma Modes, this gives you unlimited amount of Themes you can create and use!


---


‚ö†Ô∏è Themes are derived only from all top-level variable and style folder names.


Supported Figma Variables:

  1. Fill color
  2. Stroke color
  3. Stroke width
  4. Gradient stop color
  5. Corner radius
  6. Shadow color
  7. Size
  8. Gap, Padding
  9. Opacity
  10. Show/Hide


Supported Figma Styles:

  1. Color
  2. Text
  3. Effect


Will be adding more, let me know if something is not working as expected!


Enjoy! üòé
plugins.tagline: Swap selected variables and styles to another theme, based on a folder/group name

plugins.name: Color Ramp Generator
plugins.description:
Introducing the Color Ramp Generator plugin - designed to streamline your workflow and ensure accessibility across all your designs. This tool allows you to generate a color ramp from any HEX color you provide, ensuring each color meets predefined contrast ratios for accessibility.


Simply enter your HEX code (with or without the ‚Äú#‚Äù), give it a name and the plugin will automatically generate a 15-color gradient. It adjusts the lightness to meet the exact contrast ratios, while preserving the hue and saturation of your colors.


This color system integrates accessibility directly into your design process. In my past projects, clients often provided incomplete brand guidelines, especially regarding accessibility. To solve this, I created a method to generate accessible color ramps, assigning each shade a number for easy reference. I specifically built this system to support white-labeling requirements, enabling quick and easy customization for different brands while maintaining accessibility standards.


Each color in the palette is numbered from 5 to 100, with the darkest color assigned ‚Äú5‚Äù and the brightest color assigned ‚Äú100.‚Äù


Here‚Äôs the key feature: a points-based color system.

‚Ä¢ A 40-point difference between shades meets a 3:1 contrast ratio.

‚Ä¢ A 50-point difference meets a 4.5:1 ratio.

‚Ä¢ A 60-point difference meets a 7:1 ratio.


This system allows you to easily achieve AA and AAA accessibility standards by assigning colors to objects accordingly.


Cross-Palette Accessibility: This feature ensures that colors from different palettes are also accessible when combined. For example, Color 30 from one palette and Color 80 from another palette will automatically have a 50-point difference, which meets the 4.5:1 contrast ratio requirement. This makes it easy to mix colors from different palettes while maintaining accessibility.


The output generated is clean and ready for use in your design system, ensuring that your designs not only meet accessibility standards but also look polished and professional.


With this system, you can reduce your toolkit setup time from days to under a minute, saving 99% of the time.
plugins.tagline: Create color shades to establish a color system.

plugins.name: Export to WebP
plugins.description:
Export to WebP transforms your Figma frames into optimised WebP images with just a few clicks.


WebP offers significantly smaller file sizes compared to PNG while maintaining excellent visual quality - perfect for web projects where performance matters.


Key Features


Smart Target File Size Optimisation ‚ú® NEW

‚Ä¢Set your desired file size (e.g., "100 KB" or "2 MB") and let the plugin automatically find the perfect quality setting

‚Ä¢Advanced binary search algorithm optimises quality to hit your exact target size

‚Ä¢Real-time progress feedback shows optimisation iterations

‚Ä¢Perfect for meeting specific file size requirements or bandwidth constraints

‚†Ä

Advanced Transparency Control ‚ú® NEW

‚Ä¢Preserve or remove alpha channel (transparency) based on your needs

‚Ä¢Keep transparent backgrounds for overlays and UI elements

‚Ä¢Remove transparency for smaller file sizes when opacity isn't needed

‚Ä¢Smart default settings optimize for most common use cases


Efficient WebP Conversion

‚Ä¢Convert any Figma element to WebP format with high-quality results

‚Ä¢Save up to 30-75% in file size compared to PNG format

‚Ä¢Maintain visual quality while dramatically reducing file sizes


Flexible Quality Settings

‚Ä¢Choose from preset quality options (High Quality, Web Optimised, Ultra Compressed)

‚Ä¢Fine-tune compression with a precise quality slider (0-100%)

‚Ä¢Create and save custom quality presets for your specific needs


Batch Processing

‚Ä¢Convert multiple elements simultaneously

‚Ä¢Real-time progress tracking with accurate completion estimates

‚Ä¢Optimised memory usage for handling large selections


Export Options

‚Ä¢Save as a single ZIP file containing all WebP images

‚Ä¢Download individual WebP files directly

‚Ä¢Automatic naming based on your Figma layer structure


Detailed Statistics

‚Ä¢View before/after file size comparisons

‚Ä¢See exact file size savings for each conversion

‚Ä¢Track total compression savings across your selection


Simple Workflow

‚Ä¢Select elements ‚Üí Choose quality ‚Üí Convert ‚Üí Download

‚Ä¢Integrates seamlessly with your Figma workflow

‚Ä¢Works with frames, components, groups, shapes, text, and more


Performance Optimised

‚Ä¢Fast conversions even for high-resolution graphics

‚Ä¢Memory-efficient processing for large batches


Please leave some feedback if you find this plugin useful :)
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to WebP - smaller files, same quality

plugins.name: Quick Constraints
plugins.description:
Specify constraints with a single command in the quick actions with a keyboard only instead of manually setting constraints through the Figma UI. Just select the objects, enter the command, and the plugin will apply the constraints accordingly.


List of commands

L, R, T, B ‚Äî Left / Right / Top / Bottom

Alternative: W, A, S, D

V, H, C (or CV, CH) ‚Äî Center Vertical / Horizontal / Both

SH, SV, SS ‚Äî Scale Vertical / Horizontal / Both


Quick usage

To quickly open the plugin, use Cmd + K (open quick actions) and search for QC (Quick Constraints), then press Enter and type the command. After typing the command press Enter again to run it.


Examples

WASD ‚Äî Constrain all sides

VSH ‚Äî Center Vertical / Scale Horizontal

LR ‚Äî Left + Right (vertical constraints kept as is)
plugins.tagline: Apply constraints using your keyboard only üöÄ

plugins.name: Page over
plugins.description:
Improve documentation and project management by sharing links to Pages and Prototype flows with one click. Copy to clipboard and paste anywhere!


Page over is a Figma plugin simplifying your handoff workflow and helping everyone find what they are looking for in your file.


Sort things out from A to Z or the other way around for finding what your are looking for faster. Or add a number to every page and point out the exact numbered page, no matter how many pages you have.


To tidy up the structure and visual hierarchy you can add multiple separator pages in different ASCII styles or even create segments of pages with a click of a button.


Improve your documentation and project management by sharing links to all Pages and/or Prototype flows with a single click while respecting your file's privacy and permissions.


The complete list feature includes:


  • Sorting pages A to Z and Z to A
  • Numbering pages
  • Adding separator (blank pages) with predefined styles
  • Adding multiple pages at once (page segment) with predefined or custom colors
  • Export file anatomy to all Pages and/or Prototype flow with one click


Try the beta release and tell us what you think with a mention to @titanas

accepted.name: Stefanos
accepted.description: Making big little things with meraki.

plugins.tagline: Turnaround your handoff workflow by sorting, numbering, adding page segments. Share page links fast.

plugins.name: Wireframeit Plugin
plugins.description:
Transform live websites and HTML into fully editable designs or low-fidelity wireframes. Wireframeit accurately captures the layout, typography, and structure of any site and converts it into editable design files ready to export directly to Figma.


Use the browser extension to scan a live website, export it as a .wfit file, and import it into Figma using this plugin. You'll get clean frames, layout structure, and text boxes, no screenshots, no messy code.


How to use it:

  1. Install the Wireframeit browser extension.
  2. Click the extension on any website ‚Üí Export ‚Üí Figma.
  3. Download the .wfit file.
  4. Open Figma ‚Üí run the Wireframeit plugin.
  5. Drag in the file, hit Import, and start editing.
plugins.tagline: Convert any website into editable Figma designs or wireframes

plugins.name: Bannners
plugins.description:
Banner Generator

Easily create custom banners in any size and shape for your creative campaigns.


Setup Requirements

For optimal performance, please follow these guidelines:

Layer Names (Important):

  1. Logo
  2. Heading
  3. Subtext
  4. CTA (Call-to-Action)
  5. Product
  6. Pattern
  7. Background

Component Structure (Important):

  1. Images and groups should be components (e.g., Logo, Product, Background, Patterns)
  2. Heading and Subtext can be free-standing text layers
  3. CTA works best as an Auto Layout


Key Features

  1. Generate banners in both portrait and landscape orientations
  2. Align elements to suit your design needs
  3. Resize banners effortlessly

plugins.name: AspectMatic
plugins.description:
AspectMatic is a Figma plugin designed for developers, simplifying aspect ratio calculations. Tired of manual calculations? AspectMatic automates the process.


Features


  1. Separator Options: Choose between colon (:) or slash (/) to format aspect ratios.
  2. Ratio Formats:
  3. Regular Ratio: A simple division format for width and height, such as 300:9 or 300/9.
  4. Reduced Ratio: The simplified version of the regular ratio, like 100:3.
  5. Decimal Form: The ratio expressed as a decimal number, such as 33.33.
  6. Rounded Decimal Form: The decimal ratio rounded to the nearest whole number, such as 33.
  7. Aspect Ratio History: View and manage the history of calculated aspect ratios.
  8. Easy Copy: Quickly copy any aspect ratio to your clipboard for use in your designs.
  9. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive UI designed to streamline the aspect ratio calculation process.


How it works


  1. Select Node(s): Click on one or more nodes in Figma to start the aspect ratio calculation process.
  2. Choose a Separator: Decide whether to use colon (:) or slash (/) as your ratio separator.
  3. Select a Ratio Form: Pick from one of four ratio forms (Regular Ratio, Reduced Ratio, Decimal, or Rounded Decimal).
  4. Generate and Copy: Click Get AR to calculate the aspect ratio(s). Easily copy the results for use in your projects.


Credits


AspectMatic was developed by Emmanuel Jemeni, a frontend developer.


Built with Create Figma Plugin, Preact, TypeScript, Prettier, and TailwindCSS.


If you find this plugin helpful and would like to support my work, feel free to buy me a coffee.


For any contributions or issues, check out the AspectMatic repository.


  1. LinkedIn: Emmanuel Jemeni
  2. GitHub: @Jemeni11
  3. Twitter/X: @Jemeni11_
plugins.tagline: The Figma plugin that helps developers with aspect ratio calculations.

101546.release_notes:
Hey. Thank you for using AspectMatic üéâ
Here are the new updates:

1. Major UI Overhaul: AspectMatic now has a cleaner interface that feels more like Figma, and dark mode is here! üåô

2. New Ratio Formats & Separator Options: In previous versions, AspectMatic only supported displaying aspect ratios as Decimal Form and Rounded Decimal Form (e.g., 1.7777 or 1). Now, AspectMatic includes the familiar Regular Ratio format (e.g., 16:9 or 16/9). Additionally, AspectMatic will reduce the ratio to its simplest form (e.g., from 300:9 to 100:3) for a more refined output. You can also choose between two Separator Options ‚Äî colon (:) or slash (/).

3. Copy Button Added: AspectMatic now includes a dedicated copy button for quick copying of ratios. No more Ctrl + C! (though you can still do that if you'd like).

4. History Modal: A new history modal lets you view your previous aspect ratios without cluttering the main UI. Your old ratios are neatly stored out of sight, accessible when needed, making the experience much more seamless than the old, ever-growing table.

Thank you again for using and supporting AspectMatic! At the time of writing this note, AspectMatic has 201 users, and I hope each and every one of you love these new updates!
101546.tagline: The Figma plugin that helps developers with aspect ratio calculations.

plugins.name: AI Icon Finder
plugins.description:
AI Icon Finder is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers quickly find the perfect icons using natural language. Simply describe what you're looking for, and our AI will interpret your query and locate the most relevant icons instantly.


How It Works


  1. Type a description of the icon you need (e.g., "payment confirmation" or "shopping cart with items")
  2. Click "Search" and watch as AI interprets your query into relevant keywords
  3. AI Interpreted queries are clickable and using as a search element for better linking over results
  4. Browse the results and preview icons before inserting
  5. Insert directly into your design or copy the SVG with one click

plugins.description:

This plugin is designed for designers who need to quickly export simple animations from multiple frames in Figma. With an intuitive interface, you can import your frames, adjust the time between frames, set compression, and create instant previews ‚Äî all without leaving Figma.


Ideal for creating animated banners, UI mockups, visual demos, and more. With compression support, local preview, and optimized export, you have full control over the final size and fluidity of your GIF.


Key features:


  1. Import multiple frames directly from Figma
  2. Configure delay between frames and infinite loop option
  3. Adjustable compression for quality and size control
  4. Preview directly in the plugin before exporting
  5. Local export with real-time preview


Lightweight, practical, and focused on productivity ‚Äî your shortcut to creating GIFs directly from Figma.

plugins.name: Copy Paste Styled Text
plugins.description:
Copying text into Figma shouldn‚Äôt mean losing your formatting.


üåé Problem We Solve ‚Äî

When you directly copy and paste text from the web into Figma, it usually loses its structure‚Äîeverything gets flattened into a single, unformatted block of text.


üöÄ Our Solution ‚Äî

With this plugin, your text stays formatted exactly as it should‚Äîheadings, bullet points, code styling, you name it‚Äîit all remains intact. No more reformatting by hand. Our plugin seamlessly handles styles for:

  1. headings
  2. subheadings
  3. bullet points & lists
  4. code snippets
  5. font weights
  6. bold & italics


üå± Get the most out of this plugin with ChatGPT ‚Äî

This also works seamlessly with text documents generated in ChatGPT, Claude, DeepSeek, Gemini, Mistral, Llama, or your favorite LLM of choice.

Whether you're drafting a quick project scope outline or developer handoff notes, simply copy and paste it from your LLM into Figma using this plugin, and your structured document will remain perfectly intact‚Äîready to use without extra formatting effort.


P.S. If you found this plugin useful, check out more of our free resources on our Bento. For updates on new releases, follow @redwood.ux on Instagram!

  1. Instagram: @redwood.ux
  2. Website: redwoodux.com
  3. Kofi: ko-fi.com/redwoodux
  4. Bento: bento.me/redwoodux

plugins.name: Handoff Focus
plugins.description:
"Handoff Focus" is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the handoff process between designers and developers. This plugin creates a dedicated handoff page that consolidates all elements marked as "Ready for Development", making it easier for developers to focus on what's ready for implementation.


How to Use


  1. Mark Layers: Use the native Figma feature to mark elements as "Ready for Development."
  2. (optional) Toggle Visibility: Click the visibility icon to hide or show layers based on their development status.
  3. Create Handoff Page: Input a name and click "Create" to generate a handoff page that includes all marked layers.
  4. Customize: Use the "Keep Original Position" option if you want to maintain the original layout of layers on the handoff page.
  5. Review & Share: Once the handoff page is created, review it and share it with developers.


Core Features


  • Visibility Toggle: Options to hide or show layers based on their marked status.
  • Handoff Page Generation: Create a dedicated handoff page with all marked layers.
  • Position Customization: Option to keep the original position of layers on the handoff page.
  • Page Title Annotations: Add page titles to the handoff page for organization. (Disabled when "Keep Original Position" is active.)


Key Benefits


  1. Enhanced Concentration: By hiding non-essential layers, you can zero in on what's crucial, reducing visual noise and enhancing your focus.
  2. Efficiency: No need to manually sift through layers or groups to find what's ready for development. The plugin does the heavy lifting, saving you time and effort.
  3. Collaboration: Makes it easier for designers and developers to collaborate. Developers can quickly view only the layers that are relevant to them, ensuring a smoother handoff process.
  4. Flexibility: Whether you want to hide or show layers, the plugin offers quick toggle options, giving you full control over your workspace visibility.
  5. Lightweight: Designed with performance in mind, "Handoff Focus" ensures a seamless experience even in large documents, without bogging down your Figma app.
plugins.tagline: Highlight ready layers; hide the rest. Streamline your handoff process.
